definition: military banner/flag signal/(fig.) banner (i.e. false pretenses)
flag/variant of 旗[qi2]
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海滨救生员通常用旗号传达信息。

sentences.english: A group of people were expressing their support for the Palestinian people.
sentences.chinese: 一群示威者亮出了支持巴勒斯坦的旗号。

sentences.english: As a result, some products containing high fructose corn syrup claim to be "all natural."
sentences.chinese: 导致有些含果葡糖浆的商品仍然打着纯天然的旗号。

sentences.english: At least the banks would not be holding the whole country hostage.
sentences.chinese: 至少银行就不能打着保家卫国的旗号，发国难财了。

sentences.english: Is clearly for themselves, it is not the name of someone else's banner.
sentences.chinese: 明明是为自己，却还打着别人的旗号。

sentences.english: The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海滨救生员通常用旗号传达讯息。

sentences.english: The beach life-guards applying flag one anotIT for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海滨救生员通经日常旗号传达讯息。

definition: shop sign/signboard/(fig.) pretense
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: to agitate for/to enthusiastically promote
name/titular/nominal/in name/ostensible purpose

to make use of/to use sth as pretext/under false pretenses/under the guise of/masquerading as/lenient/tolerant/loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
slogan/catchphrase/CL:個|个[ge4]
with great fanfare
banner
to proclaim/to make public or well known
lit. to wave a banner as if it were a tiger skin (idiom)/fig. to borrow sb's prestige/to take the name of a great cause as a shield
pinyin: la1 da4 qi2 zuo4 hu3 pi2

definition: to disseminate/to give publicity to/propaganda/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. to have sufficient reason to send troops (idiom)/to do something with good reason/to have just cause
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)
to console the people by punishing the tyrants (idiom)
to call by the glorified name of (idiom)
openly/publicly/undisguised
